paragraphs.body: "Sokka the Avatar" is a comic book that takes place in ${link_0}, originally released by ${link_1} on September 12, 2006, and later released by ${link_2} in Avatar: The Last Airbender — The Lost Adventures. Select magazine sellers put this issue of Nick Mag Presents on sale three days early, making "Sokka the Avatar" available for purchase on September 9.

links.body: Nick Mag Presents: Avatar: The Last Airbender

paragraphs.text: "Sokka the Avatar" is a comic book that takes place in Book Two: Earth, originally released by Nick Mag Presents: Avatar: The Last Airbender on September 12, 2006, and later released by Dark Horse Comics in Avatar: The Last Airbender — The Lost Adventures. Select magazine sellers put this issue of Nick Mag Presents on sale three days early, making "Sokka the Avatar" available for purchase on September 9.

paragraphs.body: Sokka meets someone who will not look his way unless he can find a way to impress her. His plan will not only anger the person he impersonates, but will also turn out to cause a stir all over his crush's town.
paragraphs.text: Sokka meets someone who will not look his way unless he can find a way to impress her. His plan will not only anger the person he impersonates, but will also turn out to cause a stir all over his crush's town.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} lands in the middle of ${link_1} in the ${link_2} in order to relax for a while, but ${link_3} warns that they had better not stay for too long with the ${link_4} still after them. While she delightfully judges what smells to be deep-fried pickled radishes which changes her mind to stay here a little longer, ${link_5} and ${link_6} visit a shop in the marketplace and try on some animal pelts. When Sokka compliments Aang for what he picked out, a girl in front of him named ${link_7} assumes he was talking to her and seems flattered at first. After saying a pickup line that apparently fails, she throws the fake fox pelt she had been holding at him and walks away.
paragraphs.text: Team Avatar lands in the middle of a town in the Earth Kingdom in order to relax for a while, but Katara warns that they had better not stay for too long with the Fire Nation still after them. While she delightfully judges what smells to be deep-fried pickled radishes which changes her mind to stay here a little longer, Aang and Sokka visit a shop in the marketplace and try on some animal pelts. When Sokka compliments Aang for what he picked out, a girl in front of him named Kaya assumes he was talking to her and seems flattered at first. After saying a pickup line that apparently fails, she throws the fake fox pelt she had been holding at him and walks away.

paragraphs.body: In an attempt to impress Kaya, with whom he has become infatuated, he tries to explain how he travels around the world and saves people with the ${link_0}, but she mistakenly assumes from his wording that he is the Avatar. Aang covers for Sokka, knowing that Sokka wants to go out with Kaya, and says that it is true. With Aang's help, they trick the girl into believing that Sokka can ${link_1} in order to make her believe him, after which she offers to become his girlfriend.
paragraphs.text: In an attempt to impress Kaya, with whom he has become infatuated, he tries to explain how he travels around the world and saves people with the Avatar, but she mistakenly assumes from his wording that he is the Avatar. Aang covers for Sokka, knowing that Sokka wants to go out with Kaya, and says that it is true. With Aang's help, they trick the girl into believing that Sokka can airbend in order to make her believe him, after which she offers to become his girlfriend.

paragraphs.body: Meanwhile, the ${link_0} conspire in a forest near the town, knowing the Avatar has been spotted there. In town, however, everything is turning out well for Sokka. Kaya has taken him to meet her family with Aang in tow. Although her parents adore the fact that their daughter is dating who they think is the Avatar, Kaya's sister asks why Aang, who is wearing a fur cap to hide his airbender ${link_1}, is with him, to which Sokka explains that Aang is his servant. While Aang is made to sweep the house, Sokka warns Kaya not to let this information slip, "for security reasons." Even so, having told a few people already, the entire town is soon at her doorstep looking for advice from the Avatar. Aang, peeved by his downgrade to servant, tells Sokka that, being the Avatar, he can handle it himself, which at first he accomplishes.
paragraphs.text: Meanwhile, the Rough Rhinos conspire in a forest near the town, knowing the Avatar has been spotted there. In town, however, everything is turning out well for Sokka. Kaya has taken him to meet her family with Aang in tow. Although her parents adore the fact that their daughter is dating who they think is the Avatar, Kaya's sister asks why Aang, who is wearing a fur cap to hide his airbender tattoo, is with him, to which Sokka explains that Aang is his servant. While Aang is made to sweep the house, Sokka warns Kaya not to let this information slip, "for security reasons." Even so, having told a few people already, the entire town is soon at her doorstep looking for advice from the Avatar. Aang, peeved by his downgrade to servant, tells Sokka that, being the Avatar, he can handle it himself, which at first he accomplishes.

paragraphs.body: When Katara and ${link_0} arrive at the scene, Sokka keeps them quiet about his identity by pulling them aside and telling them of his scheme. Having agreed to play along and the townspeople wanting to see some ${link_1}, Katara helps him to look like he is ${link_2} while she stands in the background unseen by the audience. Toph follows suit by performing some ${link_3}, but this causes the Rough Rhinos to spot Sokka from a distance and decide mistakenly that he is the Avatar. They tie him up and throw him onto one of their ${link_4}, however Aang, Katara, and Toph easily defeat them with their respective bending styles. Despite all of the evidence against him, though, Kaya still believes that Sokka is the Avatar and that he let his sidekicks pretend to bend while he did the work. As Sokka walks away bragging about his accomplishments as the Avatar, his friends decide it is time to reveal the truth about Sokka's nonbending status.
paragraphs.text: When Katara and Toph arrive at the scene, Sokka keeps them quiet about his identity by pulling them aside and telling them of his scheme. Having agreed to play along and the townspeople wanting to see some bending, Katara helps him to look like he is waterbending while she stands in the background unseen by the audience. Toph follows suit by performing some earthbending, but this causes the Rough Rhinos to spot Sokka from a distance and decide mistakenly that he is the Avatar. They tie him up and throw him onto one of their komodo rhinos, however Aang, Katara, and Toph easily defeat them with their respective bending styles. Despite all of the evidence against him, though, Kaya still believes that Sokka is the Avatar and that he let his sidekicks pretend to bend while he did the work. As Sokka walks away bragging about his accomplishments as the Avatar, his friends decide it is time to reveal the truth about Sokka's nonbending status.

paragraphs.body: In the first panel of the comic, Sokka says in disgust, "Ew, animal pelts!" However, he proceeds to don a robe of animal pelt under the impression that it was real. Furthermore, having come from the ${link_0}, he should not have been so deterred; skinning animals is a custom of his people that he had encountered before, as seen in "${link_1}".
paragraphs.text: In the first panel of the comic, Sokka says in disgust, "Ew, animal pelts!" However, he proceeds to don a robe of animal pelt under the impression that it was real. Furthermore, having come from the Southern Water Tribe, he should not have been so deterred; skinning animals is a custom of his people that he had encountered before, as seen in "Bato of the Water Tribe".

paragraphs.body: In the show, ${link_0} typically sports a bogo chain and ${link_1} typically wields a halberd. However, Kahchi captures Sokka with a bogo chain and Ogodei is shown fighting with a halberd in this comic.
paragraphs.text: In the show, Ogodei typically sports a bogo chain and Kahchi typically wields a halberd. However, Kahchi captures Sokka with a bogo chain and Ogodei is shown fighting with a halberd in this comic.

paragraphs.body: Despite previously encountering Aang in "${link_0}", the Rough Rhinos still mistake Sokka for the Avatar.
paragraphs.text: Despite previously encountering Aang in "Avatar Day", the Rough Rhinos still mistake Sokka for the Avatar.

paragraphs.body: "Sokka the Avatar" originally appeared in the first edition of Avatar's very own magazine, Nick Mag Presents: Avatar: The Last Airbender, along with "${link_0}" and "${link_1}".
paragraphs.text: "Sokka the Avatar" originally appeared in the first edition of Avatar's very own magazine, Nick Mag Presents: Avatar: The Last Airbender, along with "Water War" and "Bee Calm".

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} of the Rough Rhinos was absent in this comic.
paragraphs.text: Yeh-Lu of the Rough Rhinos was absent in this comic.

paragraphs.body: The way how the locals surround Sokka, who grows uncertain at first, and ask him for advice for seemingly silly and unimportant things, thinking that he was the Avatar and would know the answer to all their questions, is similar to how the evacuees surround a startled Avatar ${link_0} at the evacuation camp, making requests in the same manner.
paragraphs.text: The way how the locals surround Sokka, who grows uncertain at first, and ask him for advice for seemingly silly and unimportant things, thinking that he was the Avatar and would know the answer to all their questions, is similar to how the evacuees surround a startled Avatar Korra at the evacuation camp, making requests in the same manner.
